1.title: Welcome to this tutorial on how to replace your bike tires.
1.body: Although intimidating at first, learning to repair your tires is a critical part of bike maintenance. \n Here, we will identify common problems, learn how to solve them, then provide common tips to prevent these problems.

2.title: Basic Overview Of Bike Tires
2.body: Click each flashcard to learn more about bike tires

flashcards.title: What is critical to repair bike tires?
flashcards.text: Bike tools are critical to repair bike tires

flashcards.title: What can make bike tires susceptible to ruptures?
flashcards.text: Bike tires can be susceptible to ruptures based on environments.

flashcards.title: Why might a bike tire be emitting a noise?
flashcards.text: Bike tires emit a distinct noise for rupture or maintenance.

flashcards.title: Typical range of PSI that medium bike tires hold

3.title: Skill Check
3.body: Please check all the boxes next to the concepts you understand.
3.self_check:
Bike Tires typically hold between 50-70 PSI.
 Bike tires can be susceptible to ruptures based on environments.
 Bike tires have a clear audible noise to indicate rupture or maintenance.
 Bike tools are critical to repair bike tires

4.title: Tire Identification
4.body: These are all the parts of a Tire. Click each image to learn more

flashcards.title: Outer Tube
flashcards.text: This is the outer tube. This is the main part of the tire focused on repair. This holds the bikes grip.

flashcards.title: Valve
flashcards.text: This is the valve of the tire, where air is inserted

flashcards.title: Inner Tube
flashcards.text: This is the inner tube of the bike that keeps the outer tube intact

5.title: Great, you are ready to move on to listening to samples
5.body: For this exercise, it is best that you are in a quiet room or able to hear the samples without interruptions.\n  This is a critical portion to identify the issues of the bike tires

6.title: Sound Check
6.body: In order to understand if you are able to repair your bike tire, it is necessary to understand what exactly is wrong with your tire.\n   Not all tire problems are created equally

audio_clips.answer: Indication of Bearing, Not a Tire Problem

7.title: Skill Check
7.body: Match the audio with the issue via Drag and Drop

8.title: Tool Identification
8.body: These are all the necessary tools for repair. Click each image to learn more

flashcards.title: CO2 Canister
flashcards.text: A C02 Canister holds air. HIGHLY PRESSURIZED

flashcards.title: CO2 Nozzle
flashcards.text: C02 nozzle can be screwed on top to safely release pressure.

flashcards.title: Tire Plug tool
flashcards.text: A Tire Plug tool can be used to insert the plug to a tire

flashcards.title: Tire Plug
flashcards.text: Tire plugs are fundamental for blocking air

9.title: Combining Tools Drag and Drop
9.body: Drag tools together to figure what works together to repair the tire

10.title: Self Check
10.body: Please check all the boxes next to the concepts you understand.
10.self_check:
-Tire plugs can not be inserted on its own
 - C02 has a risk of exploding if used improperly
 -C02 is disposable
 -Bike tools are critical to repair bike tires

11.title: 3D Model
11.body: Combine tools together then drag them to the bike to repair it
